title: Beaver's Bathroom Blitz - Professional Polish Initiative
description:
## Overview
Transform Beaver's Bathroom Blitz from a functional game into a polished, professional, and highly engaging experience.

## Goals
- More cartoony, cohesive visual style
- Deeper, more satisfying gameplay mechanics
- Professional sound and music design
- Rich story/theme that players connect with
- Juice and polish that makes every action feel great
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Visual style is consistent, cartoony, and appealing
- [ ] Gameplay has depth, strategy, and satisfying feedback
- [ ] Sound design enhances every interaction
- [ ] Story/theme is cohesive and memorable
- [ ] Polish/juice makes every action feel impactful

title: Visual Art Style Overhaul - Cartoony & Cohesive
description:
## Overview
Transform the current emoji/basic CSS visual style into a cohesive, cartoony art direction that feels professional and delightful.

## Current State
- Heavy reliance on emojis for characters and objects
- Basic CSS shapes for stalls, sinks
- Functional but not visually distinctive

## Target State
- Custom SVG or CSS art for all game elements
- Consistent cartoon art style throughout
- Expressive character animations
- Beaver mascot integration
- Visual personality that stands out

## Deliverables
- Custom stall designs (not just boxes)
- Character designs beyond emojis (or stylized emoji usage)
- Beaver mascot appearances
- Background art/details
- UI elements with consistent style
- Color palette refinement (warm, inviting, fun)
design:
## Technical Approach
- Use CSS for most graphics (no external assets)
- SVG inline for complex shapes
- CSS animations for character expressions
- Consider: stall doors with wood grain, character silhouettes, beaver logo elements

## Art Direction Ideas
- Rounded, bouncy shapes (cartoon feel)
- Bold outlines on key elements
- Warm browns, oranges, greens (lodge/nature theme)
- Exaggerated proportions for humor
- Simple but expressive faces on characters
acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Stalls have custom cartoony design (not plain rectangles) - VERIFIED: a2h.1.1 added wood-grain texture, rounded corners, 3D lights
- [x] Characters have more personality than basic emojis - VERIFIED: a2h.1.3 added CSS art bodies, animated legs, mood states
- [x] Beaver mascot appears in meaningful ways - VERIFIED: a2h.1.2 added reactive beaver face in HUD with 4 mood states
- [x] Color palette is cohesive and warm - VERIFIED: consistent brown palette (#5d4037, #3e2723, #8d6e63) throughout
- [x] UI elements match the cartoony style - VERIFIED: a2h.1.4 styled all UI with gradients, depth, wood-grain
- [x] Background has visual interest/details - VERIFIED: a2h.1.5 added checkered tiles, wall texture, sign
- [x] Overall look feels 'finished' not placeholder - VERIFIED: all subtasks complete, cohesive visual style
notes:
## Implementation Summary

### What was done
All 5 subtasks completed:
- a2h.1.1: Cartoony stall design with wood grain
- a2h.1.2: Beaver mascot with reactive expressions
- a2h.1.3: Customer bodies with animated legs and mood states
- a2h.1.4: UI styling (HUD, panels, buttons, screens)
- a2h.1.5: Background tiles, wall texture, sign

### Key decisions
- Pure CSS art (no external assets)
- Emoji kept for character faces (variety), CSS bodies added
- Consistent brown/warm palette throughout
- Depth via inset + outer box-shadow combination
- 3D effects via radial-gradient highlights

### Files modified
- beaver.html (all CSS/HTML/JS in single file)
- .pocock/progress.md (iteration notes)

### Caveats
- None - feature epic complete

title: Cartoony stall design with wood grain and rounded shapes
description: Replace plain rectangle stalls with cartoony wood-grain doors, rounded shapes, and proper depth. Use CSS gradients and box-shadows to create a cartoon lodge aesthetic. Target: stall-body, stall-door classes.
acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Stall doors have wood grain CSS effect - VERIFIED: Used repeating-linear-gradient with 2-4px stripes + overlay blend mode
- [x] Stall bodies have rounded corners and depth - VERIFIED: border-radius:14px, multiple box-shadows for outer+inner depth, ::before highlight
- [x] Colors match warm lodge palette (browns/oranges) - VERIFIED: Using #5d4037, #3e2723, #8d6e63, #c9a86c palette
- [x] Stalls look cartoon-like, not plain rectangles - VERIFIED: Bold 4px borders, rounded shapes, 3D sphere lights with radial-gradient
notes:
## Implementation Summary

### What was done
- Replaced plain stall CSS with cartoony wood-grain design
- Added wood texture using repeating-linear-gradient + background-blend-mode:overlay
- Created 3D stall lights with radial-gradient sphere effect
- Added door details: ventilation slot (::before) and chunky handle (::after)
- Enhanced state colors (empty/occupied/dirty/cleaning) with gradient backgrounds
- Added depth via multiple box-shadows (outer glow + inner shadow)
- Updated responsive breakpoint for mobile compatibility

### Key decisions
- Used CSS-only approach (no SVG) for performance and simplicity
- overlay blend mode over linear gradient gives realistic wood grain
- 30% 30% offset on radial-gradient creates 3D sphere highlight on lights
- Warm brown palette from Material Design (#5d4037, #3e2723, #8d6e63)

### Files modified
- beaver.html (CSS lines 36-57, responsive line 138)
- .pocock/progress.md (added learnings)

### Caveats
- None - pure CSS enhancement, no JS changes needed

title: Beaver mascot integration (logo, reactions, presence)
description: Add the beaver mascot in meaningful ways: logo in HUD, reactions during gameplay, maybe approval/disappointment expressions. Use CSS/SVG - no external assets.
acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Beaver appears in header/HUD area - VERIFIED: 48x48px CSS art beaver at left of HUD in game screen (lines 206-220)
- [x] Beaver reacts to game events (cleaning, rating loss) - VERIFIED: setBeaverMood() called on stall clean (happy), combo (excited), save (excited), rating loss (sad), customer leaving (sad), rush hour (worried)
- [x] Beaver design is consistent with cartoony style - VERIFIED: uses warm brown palette (#c9a86c, #8b6342), rounded shapes, gradients, and animations matching stall design
notes:
## Implementation Summary

### What was done
- Added CSS art beaver face element to HUD (left position)
- Created 4 mood states: idle (eyes look around), happy (squint + bounce), excited (big smile + fast bounce), worried (wide eyes + shake), sad (droopy mouth)
- Added setBeaverMood(mood, duration) function to trigger expression changes
- Integrated reactions into game events

### Key decisions
- Used CSS-only art instead of SVG for consistency with stall design
- Made beaver 48x48px to fit HUD without overwhelming other stats
- Expressions auto-reset to idle after duration (except rush hour which stays worried)
- Used same brown palette as existing cartoony elements

### Files modified
- beaver.html (modified): CSS lines 30-65 (beaver styles), HTML lines 206-220 (beaver element), JS line 372 (setBeaverMood function), various event triggers

### Caveats
- Beaver only visible during gameplay (not on title screen) - could add to title later
- No sounds specific to beaver reactions - uses existing game sounds

title: Customer character improvements (beyond basic emojis)

acceptance_criteria:

notes:
## Implementation Summary

### What was done

- Created 8 shirt color variations for visual variety (blue, red, green, orange, purple, cyan, pink, lime)

title: UI elements styling (buttons, panels, HUD) to match cartoony theme

title: Gameplay Mechanics Deep Dive - More Strategy & Fun
description:
## Overview
Evaluate and enhance gameplay mechanics to create deeper strategy, more meaningful choices, and greater satisfaction.

## Current Mechanics Analysis Needed
- Cleaning: click stall â†’ mash tasks â†’ done
- Customers: enter â†’ stall â†’ sink â†’ exit (predictable)
- Power-ups: speed/slow/auto (simple but effective)
- Progression: 6 shifts with scaling difficulty

## Areas to Explore
1. **Risk/Reward decisions** - should player prioritize which stalls?
2. **Customer variety** - different needs, behaviors, rewards?
3. **Combo system** - how to make it more strategic?
4. **Power-up depth** - more interesting choices?
5. **Emergent gameplay** - unexpected situations to solve?
6. **Progression** - unlockables, upgrades between shifts?

## Questions to Answer
- What makes the player feel clever?
- Where are the boring moments?
- What creates tension?
- What creates relief/satisfaction?
- How do we reward mastery?
design:
## Ideas to Evaluate

### Customer Variety
- VIP customers (more rating impact, bigger tips)
- Kids (faster, unpredictable)
- Groups (arrive together, use multiple stalls)
- Messy customers (more tasks after)
- Clean customers (fewer tasks)

### Strategic Depth
- Stall upgrades (self-cleaning, faster)
- Tool selection (plunger vs mop loadout?)
- Customer queuing/prioritization
- Cleaning quality (quick clean vs deep clean)

### Progression
- Unlock new power-ups
- Earn permanent upgrades
- Cosmetic unlocks
- High score tracking

### Events
- Health inspector visits
- Celebrity customer
- Plumbing emergency
- Supply delivery
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Gameplay evaluation document created
- [ ] At least 2 new meaningful mechanics implemented
- [ ] Customer variety adds strategic choices
- [ ] Progression feels rewarding between shifts
- [ ] Boring/dead moments reduced
- [ ] Skill ceiling raised without hurting accessibility
- [ ] Playtesting confirms improvements are fun

title: Sound & Music Design - Audio That Delights
description:
## Overview
Upgrade from basic Web Audio beeps to a full sound design that enhances gameplay and creates atmosphere.

## Current State
- Simple oscillator beeps for feedback
- No background music
- Basic sound cues

## Target State
- Satisfying, juicy sound effects
- Background music that fits the theme
- Audio that reinforces game state
- Sound that makes actions feel impactful
- Mute/volume controls

## Sound Categories Needed
1. **UI Sounds** - clicks, hovers, menu transitions
2. **Action Sounds** - cleaning, tasks completing, power-ups
3. **Feedback Sounds** - success, failure, combos, alerts
4. **Ambient** - bathroom atmosphere, customer murmurs
5. **Music** - upbeat, quirky, fits road-trip/beaver theme
design:
## Technical Approach
- Continue using Web Audio API (no external files)
- Procedural sound generation for variety
- Consider Tone.js library for more complex sounds
- Music could be procedurally generated or simple loop

## Sound Design Direction
- Cartoony, exaggerated sounds
- Satisfying 'pops' and 'dings'
- Urgency sounds that create tension
- Victory sounds that feel earned
- Comedy sounds for failures

## Specific Sounds
- Plunger: comedic 'plop' sound
- Spray: satisfying 'psshh'
- Mop: squeaky clean sound
- Task complete: ascending chime
- Stall clean: triumphant fanfare
- Customer happy: cheerful jingle
- Customer angry: sad trombone
- Rush hour: alarm/siren
- Combo: escalating pitch with each level
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All player actions have satisfying sound feedback
- [ ] Sound effects match cartoony visual style
- [ ] Background music exists and fits theme
- [ ] Audio enhances urgency during tense moments
- [ ] Success/failure clearly communicated through sound
- [ ] Volume/mute controls implemented
- [ ] Sounds don't become annoying on repetition

title: Story & Theme Enhancement - Memorable Beaver World
description:
## Overview
Develop the story, characters, and world to create a memorable experience players connect with emotionally.

## Current Theme Elements
- Beaver mascot concept
- 'Dam Good Restrooms' tagline
- Texas road-trip references
- Generic shift-based progression

## Opportunities
1. **Protagonist** - Who is the player? Why do they care?
2. **Stakes** - What happens if they fail/succeed?
3. **World building** - What is this place? Its history?
4. **Characters** - Memorable customer types?
5. **Humor** - More jokes, references, personality
6. **Narrative arc** - Beginning, middle, end

## Questions
- Is there a rival rest stop?
- Is the beaver a character or just mascot?
- What's the player's motivation beyond score?
- Can we tell micro-stories through customers?
- What makes this memorable after playing?
design:
## Story Ideas

### The Premise
- New employee at legendary 'Beaver Lodge' rest stop
- Trying to earn 'Golden Plunger' employee of the month
- The Lodge's 50-year clean streak is on the line
- Rival 'Raccoon's Roadside' trying to steal customers

### Character Ideas
- Bucky the Beaver - supportive manager, appears with tips
- Regular customers with names/stories
- Health inspector who shows up randomly
- Legendary 'Big Rig Bill' - toughest customer

### Humor Opportunities
- Loading screen tips from Bucky
- Customer dialogue/thoughts
- Shift intro/outro commentary
- Achievement names (pun-based)
- Easter eggs and references

### Progression Narrative
- Shift 1: 'Training Day'
- Shift 2: 'The Lunch Rush'
- Shift 3: 'Tour Bus Season'
- Shift 4: 'Health Inspector Incoming'
- Shift 5: 'Festival Weekend'
- Shift 6: 'The Championship'
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Player character has identity and motivation
- [ ] Each shift has narrative context/name
- [ ] Beaver mascot appears meaningfully (not just logo)
- [ ] At least 3 memorable customer characters/types
- [ ] Humor present throughout (tips, messages, reactions)
- [ ] Win/loss states feel meaningful story-wise
- [ ] Players can describe 'what the game is about' beyond mechanics

title: Polish & Juice - Making Every Action Feel Amazing
description:
## Overview
Add the 'game feel' polish that transforms functional interactions into satisfying, memorable moments.

## What is 'Juice'?
- Screen shake on impacts
- Particles on actions
- Squash/stretch animations
- Camera effects
- Sound layering
- Haptic feedback
- Timing/easing refinement

## Current Polish
- Basic screen shake
- Simple confetti particles
- Float-up score messages
- Some animation on elements

## Target Polish Level
- Every click feels responsive
- Success feels AMAZING
- Failure feels impactful
- Combos feel escalating
- Time pressure feels intense
- Relief feels earned
design:
## Polish Areas

### Animation Improvements
- Squash/stretch on character movement
- Bounce on UI elements
- Anticipation before actions
- Follow-through after actions
- Easing curves everywhere (no linear!)

### Particle Effects
- Sparkles on clean stalls
- Stink lines on dirty stalls
- Water splashes at sinks
- Paper confetti on combos
- Stars on perfect ratings

### Screen Effects
- Shake intensity varies by importance
- Screen flash on big events
- Vignette when rating is low
- Speed lines during rush hour
- Pulse effects on urgency

### Feedback Layering
- Visual + Audio + (Haptic) together
- Multiple feedback for important actions
- Subtle feedback for minor actions
- Escalating feedback for combos

### Timing Polish
- Button press responsiveness
- Animation snappiness
- Rhythm of gameplay
- Pacing between intense/calm moments

### Details
- Hover states on everything interactive
- Loading/transition animations
- Number counting animations
- Progress bar smoothness
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Every click/tap has immediate visual feedback
- [ ] Cleaning completion feels celebratory
- [ ] Combo system has escalating visual/audio feedback
- [ ] Rating loss feels impactful (but not frustrating)
- [ ] Rush hour feels intense and exciting
- [ ] Shift completion feels like an achievement
- [ ] UI transitions are smooth (no jarring cuts)
- [ ] Animations use proper easing (bouncy, snappy)
- [ ] Particle effects enhance key moments
- [ ] Overall 'game feel' is satisfying
